author: Noelia Alejandra
title: in the end this exchange of goods is as unlikely as the great Gandalf coming out of the closet
content: At first, I thought "Holy lembas, I gotta have this!" But then I remembered, I don't know what a blue ray is or what it's for. Then I thought "Maybe I could use the discs as rings!" But there are 30 discs and I only have 20 measly fingers!! Still, such a precious find has to be in my possession. So somewhere between second breakfast and lunch I took upon figuring out where in my hobbit hole I could find 719.99 "U.S. dollhairs", but that proved to be a futile adventure! Obviously U. S. stands for Uruk-hai of Sauron, and we all know they don't own dolls. Forget about finding those hairs in my little old hobbit hole. So, in the end this exchange of goods is as unlikely as the great Gandalf coming out of the closet. Hm.. I wonder what's for dinner..

author: C. Tanner
title: It is nice to see the glowing 4 and 5 star reviews ...
content: With the impending merger between Time Warner and AT&T it appears WB is attempting to cash in one more time prior to that merger becoming a reality. It is nice to see the glowing 4 and 5 star reviews from what appears to be WB employees, but I highly doubt anyone here is stupid enough to pay $799 or even $499 for what is nothing more than a rehashing of movies already produced, in fancy packaging. For those who are stupid enough to pay $83 apiece [based on the $499 'sale' price] for 6 movies that add no additional footage to what we already have, knock yourselves out. An old adage comes to mind concerning such individuals........"a fool and his money are soon parted".

author: Crypto White Knight
title: Rabble Rabble!
content: Boooo!  Hissss!

author: JimK
title: Yeah...
content: WT actual F. No....just, no.

author: Emilien Dupont
title: Careful, check your LOTR bonus discs!!
content: I have bought the french boxset and I have another issue that shows the complete lack of quality check : for the lord f the rings films, all extra discs are interverted : for example the disc with extra of the theatrical version contains the appendix part 1, the appendix part 1 disc contains the costa botes documentary, and so on. This a ultimate shame for a box of that price.

author: Neil Mc Donnell
title: An insult to fans
content:
I am a hugh LOTR fan, but the pricing on this is shocking.
I think that they have got it very wrong and hope people power may teach them a lesson.
Added to the fact that the Hobbit movies are pretty bad, and nothing like the book even, I'd have thought that turning a one movie book, into three, would have satisfied their greed, but obviously not.

author: Cory Enns
title: One Star
content: shame on you Warner Bros

author: Phillip Coxey
title: Absolutely
content: Ridiculous.

author: Maverick1776
title: Why ?
content:
As an owner of the extended edition blu ray trilogy for the hobbit and lord of the rings, I see no point to this collection at all. Especially with a laughable price like that.
Even if it included 3D and 4K versions, maybe $150-200 would be acceptable. But $499 !?!?!?

author: Gunner76
title: No chip off the Arkenstone or a scale from Smaug himself?
content: $700!? This is just as egregious as Peter Jackson mailing it in and stretching 'The Hobbit,' into a trilogy.

author: BOOTA-san
title: Bottom-earth; the Sauron Barrel-Scraping Edition
content:
I'm a completist, so I did purchase this over-priced 'sextilogy' due to the new premiums; the set can be found elsewhere for half the suggested-retail-price these days -- so I definitely feel ripped-off at this point since I had pre-ordered on this site from the get-go. Bad move for the ole coin-purse.

The wooden holder is extremely sturdy and Bilbo Baggin's book 'mini-replica' is mainly filled with the character sketches seen within the ending credits of the ROTK and Hobbit movies. The disc booklets are also quite nice, although, one disc had some glue damage.

You're not just buying 6 movies, but also the previously released extras found with the original theatrical, theatrical/extended and extended releases for the LOTR movies. For some reason, only the TV spots are located on the 'special features' DVDs and the trailers removed (along with older video game previews). The trailers are supposed to be located on the BDs along with the movie, but for the life of me, I cannot find them. As previously stated in other reviews, ad nauseum (rightfully so), it's just a shame new material wasn't allowed to be released -- hopefully one day.

My biggest complaint with the release are the DVDs... every single one during playback on either my new BD player or computer have huge glitches that happen for almost every long segment.

When New Line released the LOTR movies, the packaging was wonderful -- TimeWarner Hobbit packaging is so flimsy for the movies and soundtracks. I know we live in a 'quantity over quality' world, but New Line made it feel like you were getting both, TimeWarner... not so much. At least for this release, the packaging is wonderful, but the content is very 'ho-hum' and DVD disc quality is under par.

author: Kelly
title: What a rip off!
content:
Wow. I heard about this release from the OneRing.Net website, and I am utterly appalled at how much they are trying to charge for this. There is absolutely NO new content that isn't already available in other box sets. This is really only useful for someone who LOVES these movies, but also doesn't already own them (and those people are pretty hard to find).

It should be noted that Peter Jackson and the creative team of the movies themselves had nothing to do with this release. They actually want to release some new bonus footage but haven't been able to put it all together yet.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Worth it!
content: This item has negative reviews for two reasons, high price and no new content.  For someone who actually has this product in hand, the price is worth it, very nice detailed set made with wood and leather instead of mostly cardboard like other movie collectors sets.  There is no guarantee any other new content will ever be released, and if so, just add it to this set.  Worth it if you want a very nice edition of these movies!  You do get what you pay for in life...

author: Jojolo
title: STOP ENOUGHT IS ENOUGHT
content: no way , it's very scandalous , this price is crap. what a funk  ? This ?

author: Mark
title: Crown Jewel of my Collection!
content:
If you are a BIG LOTR fan, this is for you. If you are not (apparently a lot of the reviewers are not) then it is not for you. Yes it is expensive, but I have every version they have produced thus far, so this was a must have for me.
I do not in any way blame the makers for trying to make as much money as they can from this or any product, that is what they are in business for! If it is too expensive for you, don't buy it, it is as simple as that, so quit your winning, no one is twisting your arm to force you to buy it!

author: Geoff B.
title: It really sucks because I sailed for friggin ever to get here ...
content: The region encoding of this set is not compatible with players in the Undying Lands. It really sucks because I sailed for friggin ever to get here and now I won't be able to watch this when it comes out.

author: הֻגֺ מְדִנַ מַלֲגֺנ
title: An unexpected fraud.
content: Ridiculously expensive to be a re-edition of the BD's that had already gone on sale. Also the individual cases, the shelf and the books don'tt justify the high price of set.

author: Amazon Customer
title: It meets all expectations 😃
content: This is the one thing to get if you're a true fan of Midle Earth!

author: A. Snell
title: Not Worth $800
content:
Not worth it, for all the reasons other people have said. I already have all these films with all those features on my extended editions that I already own. WHV just wants to make more money by releasing old content without anything added. I made a comment elsewhere in reply to someone else that if I was to buy this, it should not only include the Arkenstone (because they mentioned the Arkenstone as something that, if added, would make the price reasonable), but a two-foot miniature of Smaug AND the One Ring.
I should have added, "in addition to other things". And it doesn't include any NEW things from the films? Not interested. I have lots of wood and can make my own Middle Earth "bookshelf" and I am quite capable of making my own Leather (or Faux Leather, depending on how creative a mood I'm in) cases for much cheeper. WHV screwed up big this time around.
I'm not going to spend $800 for something I already have. And neither should anyone else; you can get all of these movies-extended edition-for less than $133. I feel bad for Peter Jackson and crew getting dumped on by WHV. >.<

author: Cody Walton
title: WTF
content: $700?!?!?!? are you f-ing kidding me?

author: CJ
title: Gorgeous, one of a kind gift set
content: I already own these films but I really wanted this definitive set.  The craftsmanship is amazing.  The artwork on the book covers is debossed with gold foil stamping. Really  beautiful.  The inside spreads have very little text and are filled with amazing images.  The Red Book of Westmarch is truly a one of a kind piece. It has around 100 pages of sketches from the films.  Exclusive artwork prints from Alan Lee and John Howe are very special.  This is a perfect gift for a Middle-earth fan.

author: Mamabear2013
title: $200 maybe, but this.....
content: $800? Are you kidding me?!

author: Corey
title: Looks beautiful, but it is not even complete
content: I thought the price was a typo. How I ask, HOW can they actually ask fans to shell out this type of money for what they are offering? Looks beautiful, but it is not even complete. Even as a die hard fan, I will have to pass and instead spend that amount of money on 40 or 50 new discs I would like to add to my collection instead of purchasing these movies for the umpteenth time. It's so bad that a little of the magic of middle earth just died for me with the release of this insulting scam. Shame on all those involved. Fans deserve better for help making these films as popular as they are.

author: G. Hebert
title: No one in their right minds will pay this much money!
content: Unless this was forged in Mordor with the tears of a wood elf and the scales of a dragon, there is no need to charge such a ridiculous price.

author: C. Giordano
title: One Star
content: What an insulting rip-off!

author: YG
title: 800$??? For what??? I'm ...
content: 800$ ??? For what??? I'm huge fan of LOTR but come on what special in this collection, other than the blu ray book cases, who cares about this wood shelf?! This is must be joke!

author: benjamin Luke Helms
title: Mountains, Gandalf!
content:
This is absolutely amazing and totally worth it.
The leather journal is a nice thick leather and the artwork is fantastic. Many pieces are separate for framing individually.
The "books" that hold the blurays are very fine leather and it's just about as neat as it gets.
I love it.

author: Kenneth A. Gregory
title: One Star
content: $500 and it's not even 4K blu ray? LOL a fool and his money...

author: Aparato Pop
title: FOOLISH YOUNG CONSUMERS
content:
This beautiful 30 disc box set containing also sundry objects to reward the purchasers of this executive version collection were specifically designed for the buyer of fine goods and for one who has good taste. While 76% of the reviews of this box set are negative vs 19% positive, it clearly shows that the 76% who gave this box set one star, just don't get it. Why are there still young people from good stable homes, who leave everything behind in order to follow the remains of the Grateful dead, or Pearl Jam on tour, eating Ramen noodles, sleeping in cardboard boxes? Is the devotion to a band, or in this case, a movie, so great that the $800= retail price is but a trifle amount to pay for years of enjoyment and personal illumination, that no sacrifice is too great to achieve this pleasure?  Many complain about the lack of "lost footage", but they fail to appreciate the beauty of the project - the do not see The Big Picture.
Case in point "The Beatles". This year (2017) marks the 50th anniversary of the greatest and best rock album of all time, "Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band". The record has been released and re-released, as well as remastered over and over again through the years multiple times, so, why would someone pay $150- for the same album that's been available worldwide in almost every corner on Earth?  Because this year, they are remixing the Stereo album, re-mastering the mono vinyl, and publishing a book with previously unreleased photos of The Beatles! But that's not all... You also get a full Bly Ray disc of altetrnative versions and outtakes.
It is the same for this box set: it may appear to contain the same material as before, but this time, they have maps, a book, and remixed and remastered versions of the film. When 50 years have passed, Warner Home VIdeo will then release The Lost Footage. Until then, enjoy this beautiful box set.

author: DadOfFour
title: Fool of a customer!
content: Fool of a customer!  Who pays for massively over-inflated movies?  It won't be me.  I saw many pictures in another review and there is nothing there that suggests this is worth more than $150..and who cares about the bookcase anyway?  I want content.  I want content that has been long promised to us.  I want all of the existing content, including theatrical, DVDs, 3D, why not 4K and ultraviolet versions too?  There is simply no excuse to throw such shade at hardcore fans.  It is almost like someone said "Let's see how much wrath we can incur."  The revolt will be evident.

author: kiwijinxter
title: Warner Bros is giving Peter Jackson and LOTR and Hobbit a bad name!
content: Let's see, I LOVE Peter Jackson. I LOVE Lord of the Rings. I LOVE The Hobbit. I bought LOTR Extended Edition on DVD (no no, don't be silly, why would I buy the theatrical version?). Then I sold it, so I can get the LOTR Extended Edition on Blu Ray. Watched it multiple times and STILL LOVE IT. Then I bought The Hobbit 3D Extended Edition on Blu Ray. LOVE IT! I thought the price was reasonable for all that I've bought so I've got no complains, and I ALWAYS waited for the Extended Editions. However, I echo the sentiments of many for THIS USD$800 uber-super-limited-edition-collection of all the previous movies minus some material here and there, but full of packaging that will only serve to profit Warner Bros without any real extra value over previous releases. Now that, is just plain wrong. What's to stop a $2000 version of a 3D version of a uber-super-limited-edition-collection of the movies from Warner? There are good profits and there are bad profits for companies. This, my friends, is bad profit. I won't be buying this, thank you.

author: Andrew Cole
title: Middle Earth AT LAST!!!
content: This is truly one of the greatest collections I'll ever have! Despite many people's opinions, I enjoyed the Hobbit trilogy immensely! It is such a pleasure to have the complete "Middle Earth" experience in one Beautifully made place! An antique Book-like casing. This is Premium. These movies got the Royal Treatment! Let the Marathon begin!!!!

author: jason
title: Five Stars
content: Amazing collection! Worth every penny.

author: JD
title: Great buy if you enjoy being ripped off
content:
This is not a review on the films themselves but of this specific collection. I am a fan of the series and own both the LOTR and Hobbit extended blu ray collections. Normally I’m a sucker for limited and collector’s editions but this not worth the price. This was originally $800 but the back lash was so epic they dropped the price but it’s still way overpriced. The only thing different in this set is that it comes with the wooden shelf and a different box. There is literally nothing else different. There are no extra bonus features or documentaries added. Even Peter Jackson said he could have done more featurettes but they decided not to do that.

I bought both my blu ray extended edition collections for $75. At full price you might pay $100. Now you have to ask yourself if you think that little wooden shelf is worth $400

author: Marisa Martin
title: Love it & Wish There Could Have Been More
content: I love the set. The quality is excellent. I'm disappointed, however, that there was not any new footage included in this set (hence the four stars instead of five). I know there are scenes that have not yet been released and it would have meant the Absolute World to all of the Tolkien and LOTR movie fans if the material had been added. I own all of the extended versions of the films and have watched all of the behind the scenes DVDs more than just a couple of times from all six of the extended edition films. For example, it would have been amazing to see Miranda Otto wield the sword as Eowyn, in the Glittering Caves, during the Battle of the Hornburg. I'm thankful that Peter Jackson had the foresight to film behind the scenes throughout the making of the films and that he shared so much with all of us. Maybe someday there will be an effort by  The Studio or "The Corporate Powers That Be" to support him in rendering the remaining footage for all of us that truly love it so.

author: matthew cook
title: Why?
content: Price is too high.

author: Bloom County
title: Why Bother?
content: No 4K blu-ray.  No HDR.  None of Jackson's promised new, extended content.  At this price = no buy.  Outside of the packaging, there is nothing here that fans of the series can't purchase in other SKUs for hundreds of dollars cheaper.

author: Amazon Customer
title: One Star
content: Price is ridiculously too high

author: Amazon Customer
title: One Star
content: $800? Way to crush my dreams.

author: Tammara
title: Limited Collectors Edition
content: Tried to submit a review twice.  No bad words just referencing the product , content and price, WB and Amazon and I was blocked from leaving my review. It was no better or worse than those already left but.  I guess after spending $500 for the set.  They don't seem to want my opinion.

author: Dennis R. Clarke II
title: Stunning Set
content: I balked at this for a while mainly because of price.  I knew I would love it so I pulled the plug and I’m glad I did. This is a first class set all the way. Packaging is stunning, the book packaging has great photos and the book has spectacular drawings. The digital code as 12 movies!  All theatrical and extended. A treasure.

author: MJD2013
title: Christmas Gift for the Wife
content: I bought this for my wife who requested this version.  Yes, it's over-priced, but it looks fantastic, it has both the lord of the rings as well as the hobbit(we did not have either previous, we were waiting for them to come out together like this), and my wife requested it, so I bought it for her as a Christmas gift.  One complaint--the lord of the rings movies are not on one disc--disappointing.  I hope there's a good reason for that.

author: TruthTeller
title: No NEW EXTRAS. No THEATRICAL EDTIONS. No 3D ...
content: No NEW EXTRAS.  No THEATRICAL EDTIONS.  No 3D VERSIONS oF HOBBIT.  Are they kidding?

author: Kevin
title: Great Experience
content: I saved for this for a long time!  It was a lot of money but it is made out of quality wood and leather, the illustrations are amazingly detailed.  Very happy with this purchase.

author: Joshua
title: Outrageous
content: Criminal price.

author: CR
title: Satisfied and happy with purchase and I knew what I was getting despite of what isn't included.
content:
This release isn't for everybody and I guess I'm in the category that wasn't as demanding as most. I knew that Warner Bros. would eventually make a huge set with all of "The Hobbit" and "The Lord of the Rings" films in one big package. I bought the Harry Potter Wizards collection back in 2012 and the price wasn't a deal breaker for me nor was it an issue. I knew this would be the same type of release as well, only I was aware that no new material was being created for it.

I'm still okay with it as this massive set already contains more bonus materials than I would ever imagine or have the time to go over. What I was looking for was a set that contained the extended editions because I will never watch the theatrical cuts again. I don't have a 3D TV so I didn't need those discs. All of the previously created extras are included in this set so I'm not missing anything from the older DVD and Blu-ray releases.

On top of that is the fantastic and beautiful packaging. I took it out of the box it was in yesterday and in person, this is one great looking collection. I think more people would appreciate this if they saw it in front of them. It really is awesome. It's simple and elegant looking. The shelf is extremely sturdy and well built. The six oversized books fit snug and perfectly on the top and the terrific journal style book with all the artwork is contained underneath along with these really nice lobby style art cards in a paper slip. The book looks exactly like the one Bilbo started to write his book in that was completed by Frodo and eventually Sam. I would have to say along with my Harry Potter Wizards Set and my Gold Breaking Bad limited edition signed barrel, that these three releases are the crowns in my home video physical media collection.

I will agree that even at $499 which is what I paid for this that it is still too expensive but it wasn't a deal breaker for me like the Potter set. I'm glad I never paid $799, but I believe a fair price for this would have been about $399 retail which would have brought it down to about $299 or a little less discounted. Paying that would have been a little more acceptable, but I still don't feel like I was ripped off as I can definitely see the quality that went into this. This isn't haphazardly put together, it's meant to last.

So, that's it. I understand the disappointment from many who expected more, but this is about perfect for me and what I was looking for in a collection like this. I'm not disappointed but I get why many are. I will get a lot out of this collection. Now I need to figure out when to start watching all of these discs. :-)

author: Noah
title: Excellent Set, Less than Excellent Value
content:
The movies are incredible which goes without saying. They are truely some of the best films in the history of cinema. Jackson fantastically brings the world of the books to life, and does so spectacularly.

The packaging and presentation of this set are also something to behold. This set is truly gorgeous, and will certainly become the certerpiece of whatever shelf it may rest upon. There are tons of special features, in fact the most special features to reside in a single set, in comparison to any other release of these movies. The art and physical supplements included are equally detailed and gorgeous. Extended editions of each movie are included along with the theatrical and extended editions on digital.

So what's not to like? Most obviously, the price. MSRP for this set is unacceptable. $500? No. Way. Even on sale $380 is far too steep for what you get. Regardless of how big of a fan you are, justifying the amount you spend on this set is impossible because what's included, simply isn't worth it. While the special features included are expansive, they are also missing lots more extra features, many of which, haven't yet got a propper release. It also lacks the physical theatrical editions of each movie. Had Warner brothers included those in the set, it WOULD make it the one set to rule them all.

Bottom line is: this set WOULD be worth it, for $100-$150. But anything more than that simply isn't. It lacks the physical theatricals and many special features, making the "ultimate middle Earth collection" less ultimate, and more along the lines of "premium".

author: Chaste
title: Difficult at Best
content:
It does certainly amaze me that some mid-level marketing manager at WHV decided to 'create' this product. It has absolutely nothing new included and it's outrageous pricing is more difficult to swallow than a Trump video.

How can WHV allow this to happen? Where are all the promises made about a 'complete' package with hundreds of hours of unreleased content? Please forgive me but these are merely rhetorical questions. I believe the particular human emotion involved here is referred to as greed, and everyone involved should be ashamed, from Dominique to Jackson to Amazon. WHV has no shame of course, so we can skip that.

author: Benjamin Roden
title: Great for fans. Not for casual viewers.
content: I think the controversy concerning how much this thing costs should be addressed. Sure, it is very expensive, and it is not something to just purchase without any thought, as this much money could be used an many other things. However, I can say that this series of movies, in this format and presentation, is well worth the price if you are a big fan of the Lord of the Rings, and I mean a BIG fan. This ain't something you wanna buy if you are just a casual fan of the series, so if you just want the movies and think Lord of the Rings is cool, there are alot more affordable options than this one. If you are a relentless fan and love the series, then this was made for you. It looks beautiful on a shelf, is meticulously detailed, and extremely rare (thus the price.) There is no exclusive digital content however, so you are essentially buying the extended editions in a blue-ray format, just packaged up real pretty. It comes with alot of artwork, beautiful dvd cases, and makes for a stunning display, but the dvds are just the regular and average extended editions with the same extra content. Essentially, you are buying it for the beauty of it if you do decide to get it. If you don't care what the dvds come in and just wanna watch the movies, then don't buy this one, but if you want to make the Lord of the Rings the crown jewel of your dvd collection, then save up. It is worth it.

author: Robert L. Vaughn
title: Impressive in all ways
content: I purchased this after going to New Zealand and taking a tour with Red Carpet tours from Auckland to Queenstown, hitting LOTR and Hobbit sites all along the way. There is an extra disk in the 'books' with extra material collected from some sources outside of the EPK appendixes. The quality of the display case and the books are great and the extra 'Red Book', is a delightful addition with extra surprises inside. It is worth it.

author: Ahmad alrashidi
title: It was a good experiance
content: It was a good experiance

author: BlackDragon8624
title: Bogus listing
content: This is a bogus listing, the set will not be released until November 1 2016 and the rating will not be R. This listing was shows it is rated R, but the extended movies were not reviewed the MPAA. Only the theatrical editions were ever rated and they were rated PG-13. So don't let the price throw you off. I imagine that this is going to be over $150 for sure but that is a far cry from $700.

author: Elijah Oliver
title: No New Content
content: Warner Brothers and Peter Jackson were unable to come to an agreement on the amount of new content to accompany this release.  Warner was unwilling to produce the minimum amount that Jackson felt was necessary and so none was created.

author: Sazabi
title: Warner error in RRP. Will be corrected by them soon.
content: Don't worry folks I have it on good authority that WB have made a typo in their release calendar. The actual retail for this set made in china will only be $79.99, so it really will be a bargain for such a second rate collection.

author: Phillip
title: ONE OF A KIND
content: "The one-of-a-kind wood shelf is crafted from solid wood with design selected by Peter Jackson." said the street merchant as he fanned open his trench coat to reveal the stunning collection. Being the avid lover of JRRT that I am, I could not refuse, and proceeded to unroll the stack of hundreds that my retail job fills my pockets with daily. "Yes, yes... oh God in Heaven I must have it!" The words left my lips even before fully forming in my brain. "Right on." said the man, "How many would you like, one, two, or three?".

author: M. Shepherd
title: controlled re-releasing of these movies in order to suck every last dollar from us that they can
content: Warner Bros has done it again! If there's ever been a more prime example of greedy people trying to milk every penny out of their fans, it's Warner Bros. I would not be surprised if these guys dug up my grave just to steal the stuff I would be buried with. This has remained evident since the early 2000s with the constant, controlled re-releasing of these movies in order to suck every last dollar from us that they can. The audacious part is that they're asking 800 DOLLARS for a box set that offers up nothing new but a nice, pretty little case. Nahnahnah I ain't biting this time. I might wait for its inevitable price plummet a year or two from now.

author: Andrew
title: To Be Fair and Impartial
content:
A Fair and Unbiased Review From A Seasoned DVD/Blu Ray Collector And Movie Enthusiast

I was gifted this item for my Birthday earlier this month, and after thinking long and hard about and reading some of the comments on here, I decided to review this item from the POV of not only a cinema aficionado, but as someone who collects movies.

As a collector, I have to say this item is absolutely gorgeous. They come in a rather sturdy and nicely crafted shelf that holds six numbered booklets that hold the movies as well as their discs with extra material. These booklets are well made and bound in what feels like imitation leather. In addition to this it also comes with a booklet that contains a lot of artwork for the movie and also has an imitation leather cover. I just wanted to point out that this box set is rather large and may not fit in most conventional dvd and blu ray shelves. As of now I am relegated to having to store it in a plastic storage bin which bums me out as this is such a nice looking set and I was set on having it on display amongst the rest of my collection.

As a cinema aficionado, this set, for lack of a better wording, upsets me. They come with the same movies and extras you would get if you purchased both trilogies separately. The movies themselves are still broken up into two discs, which happens to be one of many factors that make me prefer the theatrical releases. (It is difficult to into a movie when you have to get up and change discs to keep watching it)  The storage design is not the conventional make you see on your average dvd or blu ray cases, but rather semi circular pouches made out of a construction paper like material. No matter how hard you try, you will scratch these discs every time they are removed or inserted in their pouches, which will obviously affect the playability of these discs over time. As much as I love this set up, I purchased the theatrical edition of this collection not too soon after I received this and decided to hold onto my original extended box sets of these trilogies because they are easier to shelve and access, even if they don't look as good as a uniform boxset would.

So there you have it, I tried to be as unbiased as I could, it comes down to what your personal preferences are. If you just care for being able to own, watch, and properly maintain these films, then stick to the original box sets, but if you can afford it and are into collectables pertaining to this franchise, by all means knock yourself out as it is definitely worth it as a collectable.

author: nightowl
title: insultingly overpriced
content: way too expensive, complete ripoff and needless cashgrab

author: Willy
title: Epic!
content: Exactly what I wanted. And, it came in a timely fashion.

author: Kurtis L. Burkeybile
title: Shame on you Warner Brothers and New Line!!!
content: When I first heard about this beautiful full box set coming out, I was excited! I thought to myself, "I'm getting this and I'd be will to pay $200, maybe &250 for it". Now this pre order is up and the price tag is a astonishing to say the least! To ask for this amount of money, for something that most people already own is irresponsible and absolutely reprehensible! Just a shameful display a greed at its worst. For Shame Warner Brothers and New Line!!!

author: Cautious Consumer
title: I am disappointed.
content: $800 for such a product is outrageous! I cannot believe that this is the asking price for a product that may only cost $120 to make, at a maximum... I am disappointed.

They've quadrupled that price.  Is this a joke?

author: Amazon Customer
title: I don't own this set but I was almost going to when I was glad that I had read up all those reviews about ...

Maybe the new $499 price tag is worth to new fans who have never watched the LORT series before nor owed any of the previous released versions so 1st time owner getting a nice collector's box probably is happy to spend that much money.  I just wanted to put my review here to support all the negative reviews regarding why the movie studio was greedy and not giving all the extra contents that's been promised to the fans for years.  We as consumers should voice our discontent and let them hear us loud and clear.

author: Shana

author: Kennith Perry
title: Higher than Mount Doom
content: I loved these films but when I read the price I was as suprised as when Bilbo put on the one Ring and vanished. The only way I'd buy this set is to get some gold from Smaug's lair and even then I'd have think about it.

author: Charles
title: Please get this beautiful movies in other better priced sets
content: Not worth the price, im not giving the money to Warner. Please get this beautiful movies in other better priced sets.

author: M. Gariti
title: Only VALID Complaint? No UHD.
content:
I'm probably not going to buy this exact package (because I'm hoping that they'll release the same thing in Blu-Ray 4k), but as I said, I'd be happy with the EXACT same thing in 4k.

I'll address the issue most complained about: no theatrical cut, only extended.  I am SO confused.  Why would you have the extended cut, and whine about not having a shorter, gutted version?  To talk about what content was deleted for the PG-13 rating?  You're a bit late, I'm afraid.  There are about 20,000,000,000 online sites devoted to pointing out every added millisecond and pixel put in or taken out to achieve their theatrical ratings.  Plus, if you're such a fanatic that such a tiny fact bothers you, then surely you saw them in theaters enough times to have those versions etched in your brain to remember eternally, right?  You certainly SHOULD, since it's apparently the most important thing ever!

Long story short, if the theatrical versions WERE included, honestly now, how many times would you view them?

author: Dustin
title: $720 bucks for this!?
content: Is this considered a septuple dip at this point? Plus at 720 bucks!!? Are you kidding me?! I'm a fan but I wouldn't pay a third of that amount! Quarter of the amount, maybe but sure as heck not $720!

author: Michael
title: None of Jackson and Pellerin's promised new video material? NO BUY!
content:
For over a decade, Peter Jackson has teased fans with talk of additional documentary material--series retrospectives, deleted scenes, and bloopers for all six films--and despite many of us diehard fans having purchased these films 10+ times already (first the individual theatrical releases on DVD, then the individual Extended Editions, then the box sets, then the Limited Editions with the Costa Botes documentaries, then the theatrical Blu-rays, then the extended Blu-rays, and then all over again with the Hobbit films), Warner Home Video has the temerity to turn down Jackson's proposal to produce this new material, re-package "everything" they've released on Blu-ray (but not the theatrical versions of the films!, wrap it up in some attractively but cheaply produced swag, call it an Ultimate Collector's Edition, and charge $800 a pop for it? WARNER: this is NOT how you treat your most dedicated repeat customers! Do you have any idea how much it says to us that you declined Jackson's new material, despite it having been advertised in commentaries on your own products for over a decade? I urge ANYONE considering buying this set, either for themselves or as a gift for that Middle-earth lover in their life, to delete this item from your basket and never look back. You can get every disc included in this set for less than $230 if you buy the previously released sets, AND you won't be rewarding Warner Home Video for flipping the bird to its fans. Yes, the swag looks nice, but this is in NO WAY an acceptable replacement for the Ultimate Collector's Edition fans have been waiting for for more than a decade. And it's certainly no way to treat a group of filmmakers whose six films each earned more than a billion dollars at the box office!

Long story short: boycott this travesty of a release! Show Warner Bros. that we don't appreciate being taken for a ride, and that they can't treat their catalog films this way and expect fans to happily fork over their money - AGAIN! - when we know there is a real ultimate edition out there that Warner refuses to produce.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Five Stars
content: Best purchase I have ever made!

author: Maureen A. Hall
title: Five Stars
content: Excellent! 💙

author: RojerLockless
title: With NO Extended edition?!?!?
content: For this price, the set should include the Theatrical and Extended Edition Releases of all Six Movies in every format

author: lord84therings
title: Its treachery runs deeper than you know...
content:
The Warner Brothers embarked on a perilous journey to produce and distribute one of the most beloved series of all time to films.  And they succeeded, for the most part.  But as they reached the Gates of Erebor, they realized the Dragon-sickness that had been with them all along.  They  didn't fight it, they embraced it, and they tried to throw the fans from the ramparts.  And so began a battle of five armies: Warner, MGM, the Tolkien Estate, Peter Jackson, and the fans.  Warner won, and then they piled their gold into a bed and took a long, contented nap.

Look, these are my favorite films of all time, and I already own everything in this box of shame except for the packaging and the shelf.  Look elsewhere on Amazon for very excellent and reasonably priced Middle-earth products.  Let's send this particular product back to the abyss from whence it came.  (one star to review them all...)

author: Tanmag
title: $800 for a cool stand with 6 recycled
content: What's with the price? $800 for a cool stand with 6 recycled, old (and amazing) movies?

author: Clo
title: Great collector's piece
content:
At the risk of being confused for just another Hobbit/Lord of the Rings Blu-ray package release, this one is meant for collectors, and the quality and presentation of the product shows it.  The wooden bookcase is designed in a style befitting of Bag End, and measuring at 10.5" x 9" x 10" it's a grand display set that looks fantastic on a large desk or book shelf.  The faux-leather Blu-ray cases for each movie is stunning, and the Red Book of Westmarch sketchbook is filled with wonderful drawings.  I'm very happy with this product.

At the time of this writing, Amazon sells it for $419, and I believe it's worth that price tag for serious collectors, hardcore Lord of the Rings fans, or people with a little money to burn.  I do not believe it was worth the original $800 cost.

Note: I initially received what appeared to be either a returned copy, or a store display copy.  The product box was in poor shape, and the box seal had been re-taped.  The ties on the sketchbook had been untied, and one of the Extras discs was missing (disc 21, The Two Towers Special Features).  I requested an exchange with Amazon, and my replacement arrived within a week.  It was a smooth and simple process and I want to applaud Amazon for making it so easy.

author: JourneyOn
title: Twice the price this should be ):
content:
"Collectible Hobbit-style wooden shelf made in China..." - that's a quote from the back of the box. Which you can find pictures of...well, OK, it's an alright shelf (assuming it's SOLID wood and not veneered MDF). But psssssst - Amazon sells perfectly acceptable jigsaws from around 20$ and up. Also graphite carbon paper and paint, so you could get some nice wood - walnut, cherry, etc. and make your own shelf over the weekend. Just look at the picture - that shelf wasn't lovingly crafted by New Zealand craftspeople.

How about those faux leather cases? Faux leather for that price? Well, OK, you get the Red Book. Seem to me that you could commission that kind of thing (in real leather), and besides, Amazon sells tools and books for working leather too. It's not like you are getting ORIGINAL sketches from the artists - these are prints. Reprints. Probably lovely, but then again, IMO you'd have to be a real complete-ist to spend nearly a thousand dollars for some (small) re-prints...

But most of all - most of all...you can buy the complete sets of the LOTR EEs and the Hobbit EEs on Amazon, right now, on Blu Ray, for about 140$ for both sets. IMO if you should purchase this for a loved one - well, hope your loved one is REALLY into having their bookshelves look nice (assuming the faux leather of the cases here doesn't start to peel, in time) or REALLY into art, because other than some superficially pretty packaging, there's nothing NEW here. If you are an LOTR fan or a Hobbit fan or a Peter Jackson's Middle Earth fan, IMO this set is like something the Master of Laketown would have sold, and then told folks they were ungrateful for the effort it took.

How dare we even think to expect, maybe, a special WETA-made collectible, or a book of unreleased images, or *gasp* at least a few discs of *precious* unreleased scenes for this price! Can't the *whiny* fandom understand that it's much more better, to have hours of unused scenes gathering dust in a warehouse?

My own feeling is that folks would be better served by 1) using their money to upgrade their theater/sound system, so they can enhance the viewing of what they already own; 2) Check out WETA and buy a limited edition collectible - the upcoming figure of Galadriel looks lovely; 3) put the money towards the visit-New-Zealand-in-person-fund.

Somewhere, in a dark forest, the elven king is sneering in contempt over this release at this price point. Never thought I'd review a product that hasn't even been released, but today is that day, to add to the voices of the dismayed fan community over this FAUX, overpriced, "ultimate collection".

author: Arbagast

content: Great package, but lacking. Needs updated versions, 3d, 4k & or uhd. I have these movies in blu ray already, would love to have them in the above versions, so I will wait if I can.

author: That anime
title: outraged.
content:
are you joking 700 dollars for 6 MOVIES you could have everyone autograph this set and it still wouldn't be worth 700 dollars are you out of your mind we aren't even talking out of prints here we are talking 5-10 dollar bin movies that are over printed like are you MAD? the set for lord of the rings with 5 disks is 40 bucks and you think because you added the hobbit series "it was bad" to this it's worth 700 dollars I'm outraged at this you better reprint this for 200 dollars "the price it's worth" I didn't even know this set came out and probably for good reason
I know that when the original lord of the rings set came out with the sort of digi-book black cases it was around 120-150 dollars it was a nice set and it was the 1st time you had a great transfer of the movies to blu ray even if you had every edition of lord of the rings and hobbit in this set it wouldn't be worth 700 bucks no way no how this is like I said a over printed movie and I'm very offended by this release to scam people

author: J. Owen
title: One Star
content: What a slap in the face!!  Already own everything at least 3 times.  Way to treat your customers warner!

author: Kristen Campbell
title: ... don't know why everyone is giving this such a bad review.
content:
I don't know why everyone is giving this such a bad review....I mean sure at the original price of $799.99 that's waaaay too much but for the price I paid ($499.99) I think this is absolutely gorgeous!

The first thing that caught my attention was how big it actually is. Amazon of course had it in their own packaging but once i brought it out the actual product packaging was simply amazing
I have included pictures of all 4 sides of the outer packaging with this review (I do apologize for the glare my flash made on the box)
The other very nice thing that this outer box had was that they made it so that once you undid the top tape and pulled out the lip it quite simply just "fell" off the actual inside foam box that holds the actual product it in. This was extremely convent because I have also purchased the Harry Potter Collectors edition and it was difficult to get out of the outer box they had it in.
Now as I stated before the actual product was very well packaged inside a foam box and once outside of the foam box I was completely and utterly sold on the entire collection.
The stand is solid wood with very nice detailing on both sides
The actual disks all come in there own "novel" which are all leather bound and extremely well crafted!
The extra's include Bilbo and Frodo's "Journal" which I haven't been able to get through completely, but just from the outside and the few pages I have gone through I can defenity tell time and effort went into this!
The other add on you get is a set of pictures from the Lord or the rings movies which is given to you in a very nice fold up

All in all I just can't express how nice, detailed and fantastic this collection is and how much it is now worth the price!

author: A. Anthony
title: A poke in the eye and a slap in the face to Hobbit/LOTR fans
content: This set is a poke in the eye to the true Middle Earth film fans who would want it. They've likely already spent hundreds of dollars on various versions and formats of Peter Jackson's Middle Earth films. First, there was the theatrical versions of the LOTR films on DVD, then came the extended versions on DVD. Next up, a repeat of the whole thing on Blu-ray, but they didn't mind because there was new bonus content. Of course the whole cycle repeated itself (omitting the DVD versions) with the Hobbit films. And Jackson had promised that, once all six films were completed, there would be an ultimate set released that would include even more new bonus content. Conventional wisdom would say that this is that set but, guess what? There is NO new bonus content included on these discs! So, essentially, the studio is asking fans to pay $800 for a wooden shelf and some swag. This is one of the worst, most insulting profit grabs from a studio in the long, sordid history of home video. This one is a HARD PASS at any price.

author: Matteo Pagliarella
title: Ok but..
content: Everything was ok except one of the corner was little damaged

author: Pascal
title: I just received my package Middle Earth Collector's Edition
content: I must say I do not regret my purchase. Just the sketchbook is fantastic, filled with original film sketches and new artwork. Everything is carefully done and gives a beautiful look to my collection. I just have one life to live and I do not mind spending $ 500 for this.

author: Zach P.
title: I unboxed it and set it up on our shelf (looks beautiful btw) and then showed it to her when she ...
content:
Got this as a gift for my wife. She's the biggest LOTR fan I know. I unboxed it and set it up on our shelf (looks beautiful btw) and then showed it to her when she came home from work. I had to pick her jaw up off the floor. :)

The packaging did look like it had been opened.. so either open box (advertised as new) or just poor handling in the warehouse. This is why I'm taking a star off.

The product inside, however, was flawless!

If you can afford this and are a fan of the Tolkien world, get it!

author: Martin Paternoster
title: The product looks fine in-and-of-itself, but is lacking Theatrical versions of the ...
content:
The product looks fine in-and-of-itself, but is lacking Theatrical versions of the movies and the 3D versions of the movies. Essentially, the audience for this already have, as a massively lower cost, both the theatrical and extended Blu-ray sets of all 6 films in various configurations.

So while this is nice packaging, most would be paying $799.99, plus tax, for a shelf, 10 posters and a book of art.

Advice: Buy the Extended Edition Hobbit and Lord of the Rings sets, then but the individual or basic sets of the theatrical editions. You'll literally save around $500 based on suggested retail prices alone.

If this were priced around $150, I would have considered the upgrade. But I refuse to pay for such a price gouging move.

author: Cj Farmer
title: Stranger Danger for the Wallet
content: I love these films, and have looked forward to the "Ultimate Edition" for awhile now. This is not the set we were waiting for. The holes in content, plus the lack of long-promised extras makes me think this is just WB adding YET ANOTHER wallet raping step on the way to giving us the product we want. I'll be passing on this. It contains no new viewing content, and even if it had all the extras we hoped it would, $800 MSRP is bogus. I'll wait and see if they ever release the version we, the fans, actually want.

author: Troy Blackford
title: Not Gonna Happen
content:
Eight-Hundred dollars for six movies and a large amount of bonus content. Oh, and a fancy wooden shelf.

That's $133.33 a movie. None of the extended editions cost even half that when they released. Not to mention, only the three LotR movies are worth owning. So you're paying $266.66 a movie and getting three duds for the ride. You could buy all three major game consoles and have money left over.

If you didn't already have all of the extended editions, you could easily be very excited for this. Should you be 'entry-level used car' excited? No.

author: marky begood

content: Price is a joke.

author: Bannister Bergen
title: BUY THIS NOW! FOR THIS KIND OF VALUE $800 IS GIVING IT AWAY!
content:
I think we can all agree that there are few things in life more satisfying than cracking open a Chinese manufactured, collectors edition box of... whatever. But many of you are questioning that hefty $800 price tag and asking yourself, "is it really worth giving up a few months of food to enjoy Peter Jackson's opus in yet another collector's edition form?" To this I can emphatically say "YES".

Allow me to point out just a few of this new box set's priceless features.

"crafted from solid wood with design selected by Peter Jackson."

Not only is the wood "solid" but the design was selected by Peter Jackson himself! When I cradle this box set in my arms at night and sniff the "solid" wood as I fall to sleep, I like to imagine that Pete also selected each individual piece of "solid" wood himself, then whittled each piece of "solid" wood with an elvish blade that he smithed himself. Now I can't put a price on that kind of sweet dream fodder.

"the collection also includes all previously released bonus content"

Now you can get "all previously released bonus content" in one box instead of two! Admit it, that's convenience you ordinarily couldn't buy... until now! Before if you wanted to watch "all the previously released bonus content" you would have to open your LOTR box set AND your Hobbit trilogy box set. That's two damn boxes of "previously released bonus content"! By putting "all previously released bonus content" in a single "solid" wood box, it cuts your box opening time practically in half! That's some amazing time saving value. Thanks Warner Bros!

"Exclusive premiums designed for the collection include: Spectacular 100-page sketch-style book with replica The Red Book of Westmarch, filled with original film sketches and new artwork, Original reproductions of exquisite watercolor paintings by acclaimed conceptual artists Alan Lee and John Howe, framable and wall-ready"

Exclusive premiums! We all love exclusive premiums! And for $800 bucks I can guarantee that these are the most exclusive of all the premiums! 100 pages of incomplete doodles! And a red book filled with more doodles! And color photocopies of someone else's paintings that you can frame... and hang on a wall... if you want. Now I know what you're asking, "Just how big are these "framable and wall ready" photocopies?" Well all I have to say is that for $800 they're big enough. May I remind you that these photocopies are also "exquisite" and you don't want something so "exquisite" to be too big... that's just too much "exquisite".

So in conclusion. Don't save your money. Buy this IMMEDIATELY. its only 800 bucks and Ramen noodles are super cheap!

author: Boozerx1
title: Unbelievable!
content: I agree with most of the other reviews. Even if you were to justify spending $800 on this collection, not to include the theatrical versions and all the other bonus content that has been created over the years is ridiculous. Then to call it the ultimate collection and to exclude certain things insane and straight up greedy. I have had issues with them releasing theatrical versions and then later releasing extended versions but out of curiosity I still bought them because I'm a fan.  And I have enjoyed both versions, this is Lord Of The Rings that I'm speaking of, mind you. I've only seen at the theatrical version of the Hobbit, so I can make a judgment call on the extended version of that one. But if you're going to place nearly $1000 on a price tag even if it's just for the first few months of it's release you should not exclude a single scraps of material that has anything to do with the franchise that's my opinion. And on top of that for them to release all six theatrical movies on Blu-ray as a separate collection is just dumbfounding. Just enjoy what you already collected and if you haven't collected anything purchased them as individual collections instead of wasting your money on something like this, because it's a rip off.

This is a waste of money

author: Justin D. Sweeney

content:
Hmmm...let's see $500 for movies I already own...no thanks.  Essentially they are asking me to spend $500 to buy a cool wooden holder and some nice book-covers for the movies I already own.  I guess the red book with the drawings is cool but it's not worth $500.  I already purchased the blu-ray EE's of the Hobbit and LOTR.  Those all come with the appendices and, in the case of LOTR, the special 1 hour doc for each movie.  NO NEW CONTENT...NO PURCHASE.

I anxiously await the rumored "Unicorn edition" with added "behind the scenes" features and other content for the actual movies that we know exists but, for whatever reason, WB chooses to sit on it rather than release it.

author: Amazon Customer
title: Unfitting for normal buyers and for collectors
content:
I have never bought or owned LOTR or The Hobbit before because I am against the practice of releasing a new version of something each X years to squeeze out the most of people. However, I was looking forward to someday be able to buy a complete edition with all movies in their extended versions in a one time purchase. When I found this offer I thought I finally could buy it, but the price (initially 800$) and all the negative reviews threw me back, and this is why:

1° This so called limited edition seems to be incomplete (it lacks material of previous releases) and it doesn't even have new "promised" content. I am pretty sure the content everyone is speaking about is already finished or it wouldn't be a problem to do so, and that Warner Brothers just sits on it for future releases. Therefore it is just a reselling of previous available things.

2° It is unfitting for people who look just for the movies. I, personally, appreciate bonus content but I am more interested in having just the movies in their extended version. I don't need any out-takes or commentaries but to my knowledge there aren't any editions of all movies together without it. This edition is too expensive for people like me and at the same time it's unsatisfying for people who look for the things described in 1°.

3° The price reduction form 800 to 499$ shows that Warner Brothers knows they messed up, and still it seems they try to earn the most of it.

In conclusion: Do not buy this.

author: Robert Wallace
title: Why this should make you angry
content:
Multiple sources have reported that Peter Jackson and his team proposed creating new special features for this "ultimate" release. If you've been following the genesis of these movies, as I have, you'll know that there are still tons of deleted scenes from the LOTR trilogy yet to be released. They have also been planning, from the beginning, to create new documentaries with stories we haven't yet heard.

So why won't you see any of that content - as planned from the beginning - in this set? Warner Home Video apparently decided they didn't want to spend any money on creating these new features. And then they have the gall to set the MSRP at a whopping $800 for recycled discs that most of us have already purchased (some multiple times). In fact, it's even missing discs from previous releases! You don't get the movie discs from the theatrical releases and you don't get any of the 3D discs from The Hobbit movies...so it's not even complete.

Even if you have the money to spend more than $133 per movie, you should skip this. WHV has given the middle finger to fans everywhere and should not be rewarded for doing so. The home video market isn't what it once was, but Warner apparently wants to drive it into the ground. I have no doubt they'll be successful in their venture if they keep this up.

author: thegoodlife
title: Great collection!
content: Great collection!

author: Jeff Lebens
title: This set has absolutely no new disc based content, ...
content: This set has absolutely no new disc based content, nor is it a complete collection of all that has been released on disc prior to this set. The pricing is a slap across the face to loyal fans who put up with enough multiple dips to begin with.  It is also a huge breach of promise as to the previously unreleased content it was supposed to contain.  Everything in this set plus the missing disc content with the sole exception of the wooden shelf can be purchased separately for about ¾ of the list price.  This is definitely a do not buy.  Stick the studio with unsold units!

author: Lisa A. McCrohan
title: Sweet shelf!
content: Love the movies and love the look of the set!  I can't wait to go to Home Depot to spend $7.83 to buy the wood to make my own shelf for my extended edition sets of the six movies.  Thanks for the awesome idea Warner Bros!

author: John Mathews
title: One does not simply rip off
content: Lol like I said before, I want to know what good stuff WB are smoking in thinking anyone would pay this money for a 20 cent piece of wood from China. Lolllllll

author: Maidstone
title: One Star
content: YOU SHALL NOT PASS!

author: Ryan M.
title: ANOTHER avid fan who CAN afford it
content:
"Collector" is a nine letter word. So is "extortion", which is what you get when you buy this gorgeous boxed set.

Congrats on not getting your money's worth.

The price point of this wonderful product unfortunately makes it incomplete. The cost should include:

- All six extended edition films in 4k with all special features and hand signed by the cast.
- Diamond encrusted box sets.
- 24k plated gold wooden collectors box made from a tree from the set of Lothlorien.
- An all expenses paid trip to New Zealand, where filming took place.
- A weekend at Peter Jackson's estate and a personalized thank you for purchasing the set via a massage, steak dinner, and top shelf cocktails.
- A working replica of the One Ring of Power.

Throw in these extras, and the price becomes very reasonable. Anything less would and should make you the laughing stock of the Middle Earth fan base for being ripped off.

author: Michelle
title: Looks great, but not worth $800.
content: Looks great, but not worth $800.

author: Max Kalnitz
title: A beautiful leather (leatherette
content: This is a review written by someone THAT ACTUALLY PURCHASED THE ITEM. Yes, it's the same extended editions with no new materials. Yes, it's expensive. Yes there are more deleted scenes in existence that are not included. This is a presentation bookshelf piece. That's what you are buying. A beautiful leather (leatherette?) bound book set filled with artwork encased in a really nice bookshelf with a really beautiful extra book filled with additional artwork etc. If you collect presentation pieces then this is probably for you, if not then no. Other reviewers should have the decency to say that they don't own the item and are blindly reviewing it out of emotion and frustration, this is clear as the dates of their reviews are before the release date of this set. It is a beautiful set, unless you are longing for something that does not yet exist.

author: Amazon Customer
title: MUST HAVE!!!
content: Great collection!

author: Rebekah Hansell
title: Fantastic Lord of the rings collection
content:
It's a great collectors set to have for any lord of the rings fan in your life. Its the last lord of the rings blu -ray/dvd/ collection set you'll ever buy. It comes in a wonderful light hard wood display, each movie is presented in a book set/ With quotes and beautiful art.

It also has a little leather bound art book.

What you get with this extravagant/beautiful purchase

You get all the movies

The hobbit (all) Blu-ray (extended)
The hobbit (all) dvd (Theatrical)
The hobbit (all) Digital downloads
The lord of the rings (All) - Blu ray Extended
The lord of the rings (All) Theatrical / Dvd
The lord of the rings (All) - Digital Download
Bonus features

You have to go mymoviesanywhere.com and create an account to download them all and it works great because I can now watch them Via amazon prime . That way I don't have to take them out of the package all of the time and ruin the beautiful books that they come in. Its worth having trust me!

author: Matt DeWater
title: Such a shame
content:
Just like everyone else, I've been looking forward to this set ever since they announced the Hobbit films back around 2010. I've been patiently waiting for the release the Peter Jackson has mentioned on several occasions, with never released deleted scenes and bloopers. I would've happily paid a reasonable amount for that release.

The fact that this release 1) doesn't have those previously discussed bonuses, and 2) boasts this staggeringly asinine price point, is an insult to the fans who have followed these films lovingly from the very beginning.

Here's hoping the eventual 25th anniversary set will actually take the fans into consideration and not be such an obvious, disgusting cash grab.

author: Jedi Kermit
title: $799.99 for this set?!
content:
$799.99 for this set?! Even if there was new disc content, EASY PASS!!!
Read the article on the digitalbits website for full information.
